solution_line_template: Mr. Grey paid ${polo_shirt_price}/shirt x {num_polo_shirts} shirts = $<<{polo_shirt_price}*{num_polo_shirts}={cost_polo_shirts}>>{cost_polo_shirts} on polo shirts.
He paid ${necklace_price}/necklace x {num_necklaces} necklaces = $<<{necklace_price}*{num_necklaces}={cost_necklaces}>>{cost_necklaces} on necklaces.
So, he paid ${cost_polo_shirts} + ${cost_necklaces} + ${computer_game_cost} = $<<{cost_polo_shirts}+{cost_necklaces}+{computer_game_cost}={total_initial_cost}>>{total_initial_cost} for the gifts.
After the rebate, the total cost of the gifts is now ${total_initial_cost} - ${rebate_amount} = $<<{total_initial_cost}-{rebate_amount}={final_cost_after_rebate}>>{final_cost_after_rebate}.
